1.title: Flights of the World: How to map great circle routes
1.description:
Published by: Il Sole 24 Ore
Tools used: Tableau, Python

Project description and "how to": on Tableau Public blog
Python script: on GitHub

Interactive version: here

7.title: MYWorld2030: A data project with the United Nations
7.description:
Interactive data viz for the ongoing MYWorld2030 survey of the UN Action Campaign for the Sustainable Development Goals

Published by: UN SDG Action Campaign
Tools used: Alteryx, Tableau

6.title: Commercial satellites: A data journalism project with WiWo
6.description:
Economics and business magazine WirtschaftsWoche (WiWo) published this data story about commercial satellites. It was shortlisted for the PUNKT tech journalism award.

Published by: WirtschaftsWoche (Fullscreen interactive version of viz: here)
Tools used: Tableau

5.title: Web of potential conflicts: A Network diagram for CNBC

13.title: EURO 2016: A data journalism project with FAZ

9.title: Pneumonia: A dashboard for UNICEF
9.description:
One of several dashboards done together with UNICEF's Data and Analytics team.

Tools used: Tableau

2.title: Everyone counts: A project for the International Red Cross
2.description:
First annual report for the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), analyzing a number of KPIs of the different national Red Cross and Red Crescent chapters.

Published by: IFRC
Methods used: descriptive statistics, multivariate regression, multi-dimensional outlier detection (Mahalanobis distance)
Tools used: R

10.title: OCAC survey: An assessment of red cross chapters around the world
10.description:
The project involved setting up a database that automatically reads in survey results as they become available, and analysis of the survey data.

Methods used: Factor analysis, principal components analysis, regression
Tools used: MS Access, R

4.title: What Keeps Leaders up at night: A infographic for Harvard Business Review
4.description:
Spin-off from the Global Risks Report.

Published by: Harvard Business Review (April 2012 issue)

3.title: Network chart for room at Davos
3.description:
A spin-off from the Global Risks Report: A wallpaper for a conference room at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

Tools used: Gephi, Illustrator

11.title: Global Risks 2013: A World Economic Forum report
11.description:
Methods used: Likert scales, statistical hypothesis testing, network analysis
Tools used: Excel, Spotfire, Gephi

12.title: Global Risks 2012: A World Economic Forum report
12.description:
Methods used: Likert scales, statistical hypothesis testing, network analysis
Tools used: Excel, Spotfire, Gephi

8.title: Global Confidence Index: A World Economic Forum survey
8.description:
Quarterly survey of global thought-leaders to track macroeconomic and geopolitical situation of the world.

Published by: World Economic Forum (discontinued)

Methods used: Likert scales, statistical hypothesis testing
Tools used: Spotfire

14.title: Gender Pay Gap in US Public Sector: A data project with Contently and The Guardian
14.description:
For this project we helped the Contently Foundation with the interactive data visualizations for their in-depth analysis of public sector pay.

Story published by the Guardian: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/feb/08/gender-pay-gap-america-public-sector

Detailed write-up: https://medium.com/contently-foundation/new-study-exposes-the-governments-gendered-glass-ceiling-and-what-we-can-do-about-it-f75208c121a4
